Posts.Content: Hello have any of you had experience with being eligible and being offered bone strengthening injections every six months for the next few years? My mum is going through chemo for primary breast cancer stage 3 and will be getting this in addition to her chemo and radiation. Thank you
Posts.Title: Bone injections

Posts.Content: AHi everyone.  This is my first post. I have put it off for weeks and even put off creating an account because I didn’t want this all to be real.  My mum found a lump in her left breast over Christmas. After a mammogram and biopsy we were told it was 2cm and grade 2 with 1 lymph node infected. Fast forward a month she had a lumpectomy and we had to wait 3.5 weeks for the results. Turns out the tumor was 3cm (and the surgeon got good 3cm margin around the tumor) but imfound it to be 3cm not 2cm, and grade 3 not grade 2 and 6 lymph nodes were infected not 1 as originally thought. (They took all 18 nodes out. 6 closest to the tumor were cancer)  She has invasive ductal cancer  estrogen positive and her2negative  They said that Mum needs a CT and full body PET scan to check to see if it spread. They will be Thursday and Friday this week and then results are another week after   I am so worried about her I live Abroad.. My Dad isn’t around and she has my sister who lives 5 hours away who is able to come up to support my Mum  I’ll go back for her chemo in a few weeks. Today my sister said it was a bad day for mum.  Have any of you had similar experiences?  What can I do to help? What questions can I ask the dr’s?  Is it normal for it all to take so long? should I look at going private? Would that be faster or would it help? will she be okay?  WHat should we expect? I’m  so sorry for all these questions. In all my life I have never seen my mum have so much as a cold  she is only just turned 60  I hate that she is going through all this   any advice would be appreciated   thank you
Posts.Title: My Mum - needs help

Posts.Content: Thank you for replying to me. I’m just so worried about her. She tried to go to a support group but there was just two elderly ladies and she didn’t stay. I think she was looking for someone who was a similar age. She doesn’t want to go back to the hospital for the nhs psychologist because it’s too upsetting for her to go back to the hospital when she doesn’t actually have to go there. I’m praying for good news
Posts.Title: My Mum - needs help

Posts.Content: Hi Sue Thank younfor your kind words. I truly hope these scans come back clear. The alternative doesn’t bare thinking about.  I don’t think my Mum can do anything right now. My sister is keeping her busy but she is just overwhelmed and worried so much. She has never taken anything other than ibruprofren in her life and even then at a push. She has always been so happy and tells me not to worry. She is positive and I can confidently say the happiest and most lovely person in the world. This diagnosis csme out of the blue and has completely floored her.  THank you again for taking the time to reply.
